result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) .234 [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) .234 [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert A. Nevoraski was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:37 pm - Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court with attorney Timothy B. Melms.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14tr1938-1940 and 14tr1948 (Refusal).  In case 14cf141 - State moves to dismiss counts 2 and 3.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Melms/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing. State moves to dismiss 14tr1938-40.  14tr1948 - Refusal deemed reasonable.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 3 yrs
Fine $3,145.00 - Cash bond to be applied
DNA Surcharge $250/IID Surcharge $50
Jail 11 months w/Huber for all purposes - Jail credit 30 days  - To commence on/before 3-27-15 at 4 pm
DL revocation 30 months
IID 12 months
No intoxicants, no taverns
Alcohol Assessment/Driver Safety Plan
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights, NADVI given

02:54 pm - Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court with attorney Timothy B. Melms.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also  calling 14tr1938-40.  Schiek states there is a joint request for adjournment - just need additional time to work out details.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:37 pm - Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court with attorney Jennifer Stuber on behalf of Timothy B. Melms.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14tr1938-1940.  Stuber in receipt of Information, waives reading, enters not guilty plea.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

10:46 a.m. Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court with attorney Timothy B. Melms.  Michael W. Schiek, D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14TR1938-14TR1940. Defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

02:48 pm - Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court with attorney Timothy B. Melms.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14tr1938-141.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 10:45 am.

01:42 pm - Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court, via video, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14tr1938-1940.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining counsel.  Defendant states in the works as to obtaining attorney - is anticipating bond being posted today.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

03:16 pm - Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court, via video,  in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14tr1938-40.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining counsel.  Has not been able to come up with money to retain money.  Defendant requests property bond.  Schiek statement to bond - objects to modification of $3500 cash bond.  Court reduces bond to $2500 cash.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

02:32 pm - Defendant Robert A. Nevoraski in court,via video, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan for Bloom.  Also calling 14tr1938-40.  Court questions defendant as to contact with attorney.  Defendant states contafcted PD and was found ineligible.  Contacted private attorney this morning, Tim Melms - was not able to retain.  Defendant requests court appointed attorney.  Court adjourns to allow time to complete PFAC.  Defendant requests property bond in place of cash bond.  Court will not amend bond at this time.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
